 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (PhoneStateListener)

Detailed Description

A listener class for monitoring changes in specific telephony states on the device, including service state, signal strength, message waiting indicator (voicemail), and others.

Override the methods for the state that you wish to receive updates for, and pass your PhoneStateListener object, along with bitwise-or of the LISTEN_ flags to TelephonyManager.listen().

Note that access to some telephony information is permission-protected. Your application won't receive updates for protected information unless it has the appropriate permissions declared in its manifest file. Where permissions apply, they are noted in the appropriate LISTEN_ flags.

 // In Header file, the MyPhoneStateListener derive from PhoneStateListener
 // In Cpp file, we implement the PhoneStateListener and register it
 MyPhoneStateListener::onSignalStrengthsChanged(const gaia::telephony::SignalStrength& signalStrength) {
      // Put your implementation here
 }

 MyPhoneStateListener* myPhoneStateListener = new MyPhoneStateListener();

 // Set the events you want to listen, use OR to include them
 int events = gaia::telephony::PhoneStateListener::LISTEN_SERVICE_STATE
              | gaia::telephony::PhoneStateListener::LISTEN_SIGNAL_STRENGTHS;

 // register the events and listener by TelephonyManager
 TelephonyManager* telephonyManager = new gaia::telephony::TelephonyManager(app_context_instance);
 telephonyManager->listen(*myPhoneStateListener, events);

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::telephony::PhoneStateListener::ListenEvents
Enumerator:
LISTEN_NONE 

Stop listening for updates.

LISTEN_SERVICE_STATE 

Listen for changes to the network service state (cellular).

See also:
onServiceStateChanged
ServiceState
LISTEN_SIGNAL_STRENGTH 

Listen for changes to the network signal strength (cellular).

Requires Permission: {Manifest.permission::READ_PHONE_STATE READ_PHONE_STATE}

See also:
onSignalStrengthChanged

Use LISTEN_SIGNAL_STRENGTHS

LISTEN_MESSAGE_WAITING_INDICATOR 

Listen for changes to the message-waiting indicator.

Requires Permission: {Manifest.permission::READ_PHONE_STATE READ_PHONE_STATE}

Example: The status bar uses this to determine when to display the voicemail icon.

See also:
onMessageWaitingIndicatorChanged
LISTEN_CALL_FORWARDING_INDICATOR 

Listen for changes to the call-forwarding indicator.

Requires Permission: {Manifest.permission::READ_PHONE_STATE READ_PHONE_STATE}

See also:
onCallForwardingIndicatorChanged
LISTEN_CELL_LOCATION 

Listen for changes to the device's cell location.

Note that this will result in frequent callbacks to the listener. Requires Permission: {Manifest.permission::ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION}

If you need regular location updates but want more control over the update interval or location precision, you can set up a listener through the {location manager} instead.

See also:
onCellLocationChanged
LISTEN_CALL_STATE 

Listen for changes to the device call state.

Requires Permission: {Manifest.permission::READ_PHONE_STATE READ_PHONE_STATE}

See also:
onCallStateChanged
LISTEN_DATA_CONNECTION_STATE 

Listen for changes to the data connection state (cellular).

See also:
onDataConnectionStateChanged
LISTEN_DATA_ACTIVITY 

Listen for changes to the direction of data traffic on the data connection (cellular).

Requires Permission: {Manifest.permission::READ_PHONE_STATE READ_PHONE_STATE} Example: The status bar uses this to display the appropriate data-traffic icon.

See also:
onDataActivity
LISTEN_SIGNAL_STRENGTHS 

Listen for changes to the network signal strengths (cellular).

Example: The status bar uses this to control the signal-strength icon.

See also:
onSignalStrengthsChanged

virtual void gaia::telephony::PhoneStateListener::onCellInfoChanged ( const CellInfo &  cellInfo) [virtual]

Callback invoked when a observed cell info gets changed.

A notification should be sent when: 1. a cell is newly-observed. 2. a observed cell is not visible. 3. any of the cell info of a observed cell has changed.
